aboutMarito.intro: The term 'Mafoko' originates from Xitsonga, translating to 'words' or 'names'. This is a progressive web application that bridges the gap between South Africa's rich linguistic heritage and modern digital accessibility. Language enthusiasts, NLP researchers, and linguists can use Marito as a unified platform to explore, contribute to, and preserve multilingual glossaries, dictionaries, and terminology banks across 11 of South Africa's official languages.
aboutMarito.mission: Mafoko works seamlessly both offline and online, empowering communities to access comprehensive language resources, submit feedback, and collaborate on robust lexicons for low-resource languages. This platform is part of an ongoing initiative by DSFSI (Data Science for Social Impact) at the University of Pretoria to democratize linguistic resources and advance natural language processing research for African languages.

aboutMofoko.title: About Mafoko
aboutMofoko.content: Mafoko (meaning “words” in Setswana) is a multilingual platform designed to celebrate and connect South Africa’s 11 official languages.

whyMafoko.title: Why Mafoko exists
whyMafoko.content: South Africa’s languages are vibrant, expressive, and deeply tied to our identity, yet many of them remain underrepresented in the digital world. Mafoko was built to change that. It brings together words and meanings from multiple glossaries into one searchable space, making it easier than ever to explore terms, understand translations, and learn across all 11 official languages.
whyMafoko.content2: Whether you’re online or offline, Mafoko keeps language knowledge within reach. It also encourages collaboration, letting communities suggest updates, share insights, and help improve the quality of each glossary entry over time.
whyMafoko.content3: By turning scattered linguistic resources into one living, growing platform, Mafoko helps preserve our heritage while supporting inclusive education and natural language research for low-resource languages.

whoMafoko.title: Who it’s for
whoMafoko.content: Students, educators, researchers, and anyone passionate about language and culture.

howMafoko.title: How to use Mafoko
howMafoko.content: You can use Mafoko to search for terms, explore different language domains, view translations, and even share your own feedback to help improve the platform.

termsAndConditions.title: Terms and Conditions
termsAndConditions.welcome: Welcome to Mafoko, a multilingual platform developed and operated by the Data Science for Social Impact (DSFSI) group at the University of Pretoria. By using Mafoko, you agree to these Terms and Conditions. Please read them carefully before accessing or contributing to the platform.
termsAndConditions.purpose: Mafoko (meaning “words” in Setswana) is an educational, non-commercial platform that promotes South Africa’s 11 official languages by providing access to multilingual glossaries and linguistic resources. The platform is designed to support inclusive learning, research, and collaboration across language communities.
termsAndConditions.user: To contribute to Mafoko, such as submitting terms, voting, commenting, or applying to become a linguist, users must create an account. You agree to provide accurate and truthful information when registering and to maintain the confidentiality of your login details. DSFSI reserves the right to suspend or remove accounts that violate these Terms or submit inappropriate content.
termsAndConditions.contribution: Mafoko allows users to submit terms, translations, definitions, and comments. By contributing content, you grant DSFSI a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to display, reproduce, and distribute your contributions within Mafoko for educational and research purposes.
termsAndConditions.contribution2: All submissions must be relevant, respectful, and linguistically appropriate. Content that is discriminatory, offensive, or misleading will be removed, and repeated violations may result in account suspension.
termsAndConditions.linguist: Users who wish to become linguists on the platform may apply by providing proof of scholarly publications (such as Google Scholar records). DSFSI reserves the right to review and verify credentials before granting linguist-level permissions.
termsAndConditions.property: The Mafoko platform, including its design, structure, and compiled glossaries, is the intellectual property of DSFSI and the University of Pretoria. Individual terms and translations remain the property of their respective authors and contributors, but may be reused within Mafoko for educational and research purposes as outlined above.
termsAndConditions.accuracy: While Mafoko aims to provide accurate and reliable linguistic information, DSFSI makes no guarantees regarding the completeness or correctness of content. The platform is offered “as is” for educational use, and DSFSI is not liable for any errors, omissions, or outcomes resulting from its use.
termsAndConditions.commercial: Mafoko is provided free of charge for educational and research purposes. No content from the platform may be reproduced, redistributed, or used for commercial gain without prior written consent from DSFSI.
termsAndConditions.privacy: Mafoko does not use cookies, analytics tracking, or advertising services. Account information is stored solely to enable user participation and maintain platform functionality. DSFSI does not share personal data with third parties.
termsAndConditions.change: DSFSI may update these Terms and Conditions periodically to reflect improvements or policy changes. Continued use of Mafoko after updates indicates your acceptance of the revised terms.
termsAndConditions.contact: For any questions or concerns regarding these Terms and Conditions, please contact the Data Science for Social Impact (DSFSI) group at the University of Pretoria.

termHelpPage.title: Understanding the Dictionary
termHelpPage.intro: The Dictionary is where you can look up multilingual term definitions across all of South Africa’s 11 official languages. It supports fast searching, filtering by language or domain, and offline access once dictionaries are downloaded.
termHelpPage.overviewBody: The Dictionary allows you to look up multilingual term definitions across all of South Africa’s 11 official languages.
termHelpPage.whatIsATermBody: Each term in Mafoko includes the following details:

termFields.language: Language: One of South Africa’s 11 official languages.
termFields.definition: Definition: A clear explanation of the term’s meaning.
termFields.related: Related Terms: Links to terms with similar or connected meanings.

termHelpPage.languagesBody: Mafoko supports all 11 official South African languages. You can filter your searches to focus on a single language or explore terms across all of them.
termHelpPage.searchBody1: The search functionality in Mafoko helps you explore glossary terms quickly across all 11 official languages.
termHelpPage.searchBody2: As you type, Mafoko performs a live search, updating results in real-time.

searchFields.term: Term: The primary label or phrase representing a concept.
searchFields.definition: Definition: Terms whose explanations contain your search keywords will also appear.
searchFields.filters: Filters: Restrict by language or domain.

termHelpPage.searchLiveBody: Mafoko may suggest possible completions or related terms as you type.
termHelpPage.searchSensitivityBody: By default, Mafoko performs exact or near-exact matching, but fuzzy search can also be enabled.
termHelpPage.searchResultBody: Terms are shown in cards with term name, language, domain, definition, and voting buttons.
termHelpPage.filtersBody: To narrow results, apply filters from the search page.

filtersList.language: Language: Restrict results to a single language.
filtersList.domain: Domain: Focus on areas like Education, Health, or Technology.
filtersList.fuzzy: Fuzzy Search: Find terms even if there are typos or spelling differences.

termHelpPage.viewBody: Click the View button on a term card to open its full definition and explore related terms.
termHelpPage.offlineBody: Mafoko can be used offline by downloading glossaries in advance.
offlineSteps: Select the glossaries you want to download.
Click Download to save them locally.
termHelpPage.offlineEnd: After downloading, terms in that glossary remain available even offline.

workspaceHelpPage.title: Understanding the Workspace
workspaceHelpPage.intro: The Workspace allows you to save terms and glossaries you’re interested in, organize them into groups, and manage those groups. It’s also where you can track the progress of your term submissions and keep notes related to your work.
workspaceHelpPage.groupsBody: Groups help you organize saved terms. You can create new groups, rename them, or delete groups you no longer need.
groupsSteps: Create a Group: Click the New Group button, enter a name, select terms, and confirm by clicking Add Terms.
Rename a Group: Click the pencil icon next to the group name, update the name, and confirm by clicking Rename Group.
Delete a Group: Click the delete group icon, select the groups you want to remove, and confirm the action.
workspaceHelpPage.moveBody: To move a term to a different group, click the move icon next to the term and select the new group from your list.
workspaceHelpPage.notesBody: Notes let you add extra context to saved terms. You can create, edit, or delete notes directly in the Workspace.
notesSteps: Add a Note: Click the note icon next to a term, type your note, and click Save.
Edit a Note: Click the pencil icon, update the text, and confirm by clicking Save.
Delete a Note: Use the delete option to remove notes you no longer need.
workspaceHelpPage.deleteBody: You can remove items from your Workspace at any time:
deleteSteps: Delete a Term: Go to Saved Terms, click the delete icon, and confirm.
Delete a Glossary: Go to Saved Glossaries, click the remove option, and confirm.

settingsHelpPage.title: Settings & Customization
settingsHelpPage.intro: Use the Settings page to adjust your preferences — including theme, profile details, and accessibility — to create the best experience for you.
settingsHelpPage.modesTitle: Switching Between Light and Dark Mode
settingsHelpPage.modesBody: Mafoko lets you quickly toggle between light mode and dark mode to match your visual preference and environment. This feature is available on every page and updates the interface instantly without disrupting your workflow.
modesSteps: Find the Toggle: Look for the sun/moon icon at the bottom-left corner of the sidebar.
Switch Modes: Click the icon to instantly change between Light and Dark Mode.
settingsHelpPage.profileBody: You can update your name, email, or password at any time from your profile settings. Each change requires confirmation for security purposes.
profileSteps: Update Name: Click Edit Name, enter your new name, confirm with your password, and click Save.
Update Email: Click Edit Email, provide your new address, confirm with your password, and click Save.
Update Password: Click Edit Password, type your new password, confirm it, and click Save.
settingsHelpPage.accessibilityBody: Mafoko provides a range of accessibility options so you can tailor the app to your needs. You can adjust the language, text size, spacing, and colour contrast directly from the settings menu.
accessibilitySteps: Change App Language: Open the language drop-down and select your preferred language.
Enable High Contrast Mode: Click the High Contrast toggle to switch to a high-contrast colour scheme.

leaningPathHelp.title: Understanding Learning Paths
leaningPathHelp.section1: The Learning Path feature lets you design a guided journey for learning one of South Africa’s official languages. By selecting a language and choosing the resources you want to study, you can follow a structured path rather than exploring at random.
leaningPathHelp.section2: Each learning path combines glossaries, practice tools, and progress tracking to help you stay motivated and consistent.
leaningPathHelp.section3: Your browser does not support the video tag.
leaningPathHelp.section4: After choosing a language, you’ll be prompted to pick a glossary. Each glossary is organized by domain (Education, Health, Technology) so you can focus on the vocabulary that matters most to you.
leaningPathHelp.section5: Once your glossary is set, you can choose how you want to study
leaningPathHelp.section7: Answer questions to test your knowledge and reinforce what you’ve learned.
leaningPathHelp.section9: Use flashcard-style review to build recognition and recall of terms at your own pace.
leaningPathHelp.section10: Learning with Tests and Study Cards
leaningPathHelp.section12: The Learning Path tracks your activity so you can see how far you’ve come. Progress is displayed alongside your community stats, making it easy to stay motivated.
leaningPathHelp.section13: Combine Learning Paths with weekly challenges and achievements to earn badges while improving your language skills.
